title: Yum.
content:
Hi Folks, as ever my love for these type of fonts continues. I hope some one could maybe offer some insight.  
this time from a very nice looking book from the u.k called LeGun [http://legun.co.uk/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/legun.co.uk/)

Thanks in advance.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LG3_004_4746.jpg)

 [‹ (x) The Bounty Trilogy open modern serif - Bodoni Open {Mark S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/typophile.com/node/36934 "Go to previous forum topic") [Slab Serif: Ad Art Design headings ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/typophile.com/node/41137 "Go to next forum topic")
author: insertmoney

comments.content: This looks authentic letterpress, or at least a very good emulation thereof. You could start with [Grotesque No. 9](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/grotesque_no_9_ot_std/), [Rhode](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/rhode_medium_condensed/), [Bureau Grot](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/bureau_grot_condensed_bold/) or [FF Hydra](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/fontfont/ff_hydra_bold/) and add some judicious weathering effects.

nice, i think i’m due a letterpress course. Thanks for your help.

barrett.

[www.misprintedtype.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20080122024611/http:/www.misprintedtype.com/ "www.misprintedtype.com") offer a whole lot of very cool eroded letterpress style fonts like this one.

definitely worth a look...

:::::::::::::::::::::  
Wicked Design Potions
